Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar to (61.54%) toZ4R: 46%, I: 46%.Activity: active against 4 strains E. coli ATCC 9637 or SYP-B3820/B4288/B4289 (MIC 16-32 ug/ml), 3 strains A. baumannii SYP-B4290/B4291/B3819 (MIC 16-32 ug/ml), S-paratyphi ATCC 14028 (MIC 32 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae CMCC46117 (MIC 16 ug/ml), and P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC 32 ug/ml).Warning: only Gram- bacteria were tested.In vitro toxicity: 5.89% hemolysis at 128 ug/ml, HC50>100 ug/ml, poorly hemo.lytic.
Literature Information.Author: Zhang MY, Li S, Han YL, Shi YF, Wu YY, Cheng J, Wang CY, Zhou XY, Zhang YX. 2025
Literature Information.Title: De novo-designed amphiphilic alpha-helical peptide Z2 exhibits broad-spectrum antimicrobial, anti-biofilm, and anti-inflammatory efficacy in acute Pseudomonas aeruginosa pneumonia.
